scenario: AT&T's stock has risen by 36% over the past year and currently trades at 18 times its trailing earnings, higher than its historical average. The company's dividend yield remains high at 5%, well above the S&P 500 average of 1.3%. AT&T's business is stable, with revenue down by less than 1% year over year and adjusted operating income unchanged from the prior-year period. The company projects free cash flow of $17 billion to $18 billion for 2024, supporting its dividend payout of $8 billion for the year. With a high debt load of over $126 billion and interest rates remaining elevated, there may not be much room for AT&T's stock to climb significantly higher without a significant increase in profitability. The company is scheduled to report earnings on January 27.
